title: Add editable Inside section to Dashboard

requirements.summary: Add a new "Inside" Dashboard card that supports view/edit with Edit/Save/Cancel interactions and persists text to a dedicated localStorage key.
acceptanceCriteria: Dashboard shows a new card/section with the title "Inside".
The section supports toggling between read-only and edit mode (e.g., Edit/Save/Cancel) consistent with the existing "Quick Note" interactions.
The editable content persists across page reloads via localStorage using a new dedicated storage key (not reusing 'dashboard-note' or 'dashboard-title').
All user-facing text in this section is in English.

file_operations.description: Create a new localStorage-backed hook (mirroring the existing useDashboardNote pattern) for the Dashboard "Inside" freeform text, using a new dedicated storage key (e.g., 'dashboard-inside') and versioned stored payload.

Add an "Inside" Card section that uses existing shadcn/ui components (Card, Button, Textarea) and Lucide icons to provide read-only and edit modes with Edit/Save/Cancel controls consistent with the existing "Quick Note" behavior. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Register the new "Inside" localStorage key in the app's centralized LocalStorage key list so the app's reset-local-data behavior also clears the new stored content.

requirements.summary: Integrate the "Inside" section into the existing Dashboard layout in a responsive, non-overlapping placement for mobile and desktop.
acceptanceCriteria: The "Inside" section appears on the Dashboard without overlapping other sections (Stats, Currently Working, Notifications/Charts, Quick Note, Subjects).
The layout remains responsive (no horizontal scrolling or broken grid) on small screens and large screens.

file_operations.description: Adjust the Dashboard layout to place the new "Inside" card in a sensible position within the Home page flow (e.g., pairing it with or placing it near "Quick Note" using a responsive grid that becomes 1 column on small screens and 2 columns on larger screens), ensuring it does not overlap existing sections.
